meanings.definition: To argue again about (something that has already been decided or discussed)
meanings.sent1: After the meeting, they kept rearguing the same points over and over.
meanings.sent2: She is always rearguing with her brother about who gets to use the computer first.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were rearguing about whose turn it was to walk the dog, causing a lot of laughter.
meanings.sent4: The students were rearguing their grades like lawyers in a courtroom.
meanings.sent5: The image of them rearguing in the hallway is etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: To present arguments again in support of (a position or idea)
meanings.sent1: He kept rearguing his case to convince the jury of his innocence.
meanings.sent2: The politician was rearguing his policies to gain more support from the public.
meanings.sent3: The cat was rearguing for more treats by meowing loudly at its owner.
meanings.sent4: The coach was rearguing his strategies to motivate the team for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent5: The sound of him rearguing his beliefs echoed through the room.
